title: Looking for a legible type
content:
Hi..   
I was looking for a type that has an excelent legibility in small size body such as 7pt. The type would be used in infographics and financial tables.   
I appreciate if someone could help me.   
   
Thanx a lot   
   
Alex
author: alex_f_h

comments.content:
Adsans is a reliable old dog:   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/adsans/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018224648/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/adsans/)   
   
Frere-Jones's recent Retina would be great, but it's not available retail.   
   
Then there's Burke's Pragma:   
 [http://www.neufville.com/FontData/\_PragSet.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018224648/http:/www.neufville.com/FontData/_PragSet.htm)   
BTW, what happened to the Hibernia foundry site?   
   
hhp

Chris Burke's [Celeste Small Text](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018224648/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdisplay&displayfontid=FF.11068.0.0&packagefontid=0&view=package&searchID=0&searchby=keyword&searchletter=A&searchstr=celeste&totalrecords=60&startrow=41&records=20&currpage=3) ... Chris used it for his sidenotes in his book on [Paul Renner](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018224648/http:/www.typophile.com/books/archives/2%20Graphic%20Design:%20History.html#000074).
